channel.title: CU ELP Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: Thought provoking ideas about leadership.
channel.itunes:author: Spencer Wegner
channel.itunes:summary: Interviews exploring ideas about leadership. Targeted at students in the Engineering Leadership Program at the University of Colorado Boulder.
channel.description: Interviews exploring ideas about leadership. Targeted at students in the Engineering Leadership Program at the University of Colorado Boulder.

item.itunes:title: Episode 6 Dan Larremore
item.title: Episode 6 Dan Larremore
item.itunes:author: Spencer Wegner
item.itunes:subtitle: A conversation with Assistant Professor of Computer Science at the BioFrontiers Institute, Dan Larremore.
item.itunes:summary: A conversation with Assistant Professor of Computer Science at the BioFrontiers Institute, Dan Larremore.
item.description: A conversation with Assistant Professor of Computer Science at the BioFrontiers Institute, Dan Larremore. We talk about his interesting career path and how he got to where he is today, how network analysis can help eliminate malaria and bring insight into academic labor markets, his thoughts on teaching, and the importance of focusing on learning while not worrying about what you don’t know.
item.content:encoded: A conversation with Assistant Professor of Computer Science at the BioFrontiers Institute, Dan Larremore. We talk about his interesting career path and how he got to where he is today, how network analysis can help eliminate malaria and bring insight into academic labor markets, his thoughts on teaching, and the importance of focusing on learning while not worrying about what you don’t know..

item.itunes:title: Episode 5 Stephanie Wurtz
item.title: Episode 5 Stephanie Wurtz
item.itunes:author: Spencer Wegner
item.itunes:subtitle: A conversation with Assistant Vice President for Communications at Colorado College and President of the Pikes Peak Road Runners, Stephanie Wurtz.
item.itunes:summary: A conversation with Assistant Vice President for Communications at Colorado College and President of the Pikes Peak Road Runners, Stephanie Wurtz. We talk about her professional experience and leadership in communications, the gender gap in mountain, ultra, and trail running, her work with the Pikes Peak Road Runners, and much more!
item.description: A conversation with Assistant Vice President for Communications at Colorado College and President of the Pikes Peak Road Runners, Stephanie Wurtz. We talk about her professional experience and leadership in communications, the gender gap in mountain, ultra, and trail running, her work with the Pikes Peak Road Runners, and much more!
item.content:encoded: A conversation with Assistant Vice President for Communications at Colorado College and President of the Pikes Peak Road Runners, Stephanie Wurtz. We talk about her professional experience and leadership in communications, the gender gap in mountain, ultra, and trail running, her work with the Pikes Peak Road Runners, and much more!.

item.itunes:title: Episode 4 Andrea Kowalchuk
item.title: Episode 4 Andrea Kowalchuk
item.itunes:author: Spencer Wegner
item.itunes:subtitle: A conversation with Herbst Program instructor Dr. Andrea Kowalchuk.
item.itunes:summary: A conversation with Herbst Program instructor Dr. Andrea Kowalchuk. We talk about the benefits of humanities for engineers, some difficult but important questions to ask yourself periodically, what we can learn about leadership in literature, and much more!
item.description: A conversation with Herbst Program instructor Dr. Andrea Kowalchuk. We talk about the benefits of humanities for engineers, some difficult but important questions to ask yourself periodically, what we can learn about leadership in literature, and much more!
item.content:encoded: A conversation with Herbst Program instructor Dr. Andrea Kowalchuk. We talk about the benefits of humanities for engineers, some difficult but important questions to ask yourself periodically, what we can learn about leadership in literature, and much more!.

item.itunes:title: Episode 3 JoAnn Zelasko
item.title: Episode 3 JoAnn Zelasko
item.itunes:author: Spencer Wegner
item.itunes:subtitle: A conversation with former ELP director and former assistant dean for the College of Engineering and Applied Science.
item.itunes:summary: A conversation with former ELP director and former assistant dean for the College of Engineering and Applied Science, JoAnn Zelasko. We discuss her careers in computing and education, the challenges she faced, tips on how to land internships, and much more!
item.description: A conversation with former ELP director and former assistant dean for the College of Engineering and Applied Science, JoAnn Zelasko. We discuss her careers in computing and education, the challenges she faced, tips on how to land internships, and much more!
item.content:encoded: A conversation with former ELP director and former assistant dean for the College of Engineering and Applied Science, JoAnn Zelasko. We discuss her careers in computing and education, the challenges she faced, tips on how to land internships, and much more!.

item.itunes:title: Episode 2 Angela Thieman Dino
item.title: Episode 2 Angela Thieman Dino
item.itunes:author: Spencer Wegner
item.itunes:subtitle: A conversation with Angela Thieman Dino (Ang), cultural anthropologist and senior instructor for ELP.
item.itunes:summary: A conversation with Angela Thieman Dino (Ang), cultural anthropologist and senior instructor for ELP. We discuss her education, research and work with Bosnian refugees, how anthropology relates to leadership, and much more! If you are interested in the Complex Leadership Challenges course (COEN 3050, soon to be ENLP 3050) and the Global Intensive in Uganda and Rwanda, visit abroad.colorado.edu/index.cfm?FuseA…ngular&id=10173 to find out more. You can also email Ang with any questions.
item.description: A conversation with Angela Thieman Dino (Ang), cultural anthropologist and senior instructor for ELP. You can also email Ang with any questions.

You can also email Ang with any questions..

item.itunes:title: Episode 1 Shilo Brooks
item.title: Episode 1 Shilo Brooks
item.itunes:author: Spencer Wegner
item.itunes:subtitle: A conversation with the new ELP Director, Shilo Brooks.
item.itunes:summary: A conversation with the new ELP Director, Shilo Brooks. We discuss his background, how he discovered an interest in leadership and political science, two different sides of leadership, what he hopes to bring to ELP, and much more!
item.description: A conversation with the new ELP Director, Shilo Brooks. We discuss his background, how he discovered an interest in leadership and political science, two different sides of leadership, what he hopes to bring to ELP, and much more!
